subject: Pls Help : automating ok click of Joptionpane
msgSnippet: hello all hi i m jagdish n i m new to java development so dont get annoyed if i m asking something  silly The Prob : I have a swing based GUI called LoginView
messageBody:
hello all

hi i'm jagdish n i'm new to java development so dont get annoyed
if i'm asking something silly

The Prob : I have a swing based GUI called LoginView which is a
typical login screen.i have written test cases to test the variuos
conditions
such as blank username and password or incorrect password.

for this in my loginview class i am using the Joptionpane to display
the
alerts to user such as please enter data or incorrect password.

now here when i run my test case the execution stops for the user to
respond to Joptionpane.this is the problem

i want to pass ok click to the test case(Incorrect password) so that
testing wont require user intervention.

please guide me if it is possible as i know it is a modal window
or there r any other better way to achieve this

something in the test case not in the GUI class which will do the
needful


i am also pasting some code 4 ur reference

thx in adv
cheers
jag

***********************************
LoginView(GUI)
private void addActionListener()
{
_OK_BUTTON.addActionListener(new ActionListener()
{
public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent vAe)
{
if(_USER_FIELD.getText().trim().equals("") ||
_PASSWORD_FIELD.getText().trim().equals(""))
{
_MSG_TEXT.setText("Username or Password Cannot be left
blank");
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,
"Username or Password
Cannot be left blank",
"Error",
JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE
);
}
else
{
if(_KESSLER.handles("login"))
{
Map mMap = new HashMap();
mMap.put("username",_USER_FIELD.getText());
mMap.put("password",_PASSWORD_FIELD.getText());
Map mResultMap = _KESSLER.process("login",mMap);
System.out.println("[LoginView] :::
mResultMap.get(\"result\").toString()
:::"+mResultMap.get("result").toString());

if(mResultMap.get("result").toString().trim().equals("success"))
{

_Start.nextAction("mainscreen");
_JDialog.hide();
_JDialog.dispose();

}
else if (mResultMap.get("result").toString()
.trim().equals("null"))
{
_MSG_TEXT.setText("Please Check internet/intranet
connectivity");
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Please Check
internet/intranet connectivity", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
}
else
{
_MSG_TEXT.setText("Invalid Username / Password");
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Invalid Username /
Password", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
}
}
else
{
_MSG_TEXT.setText("Please contact the
administrator");
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Please contact
the administrator", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
}
}
}

});


*************************************
the Test case

public void testOKButtonWithLoginWithoutPassword()
{
MockKesslerHandle mAction = new MockKesslerHandle();
LoginView mView = new LoginView(mAction, null);

mComponentList = new Vector();
Container mContainer = mView.getUI();
getComponentsList(mContainer);

JButton mOKButton = null;
for (int mIndex = 0; mIndex < mComponentList.size(); mIndex++)
{
if (mComponentList.get(mIndex) instanceof JButton &&
"OK".equals(((Component)mComponentList.get(mIndex)).getName()))
{
mOKButton = (JButton) mComponentList.get(mIndex);
}

if (mComponentList.get(mIndex) instanceof JTextField &&
"UserName".equals(((Component)mComponentList.get(mIndex)).getName()))
{
((JTextField)mComponentList.get(mIndex)).setText("Hello");
}
}


assertNotNull(mOKButton);
assertNotNull(mOKButton);

mOKButton.doClick();
assertTrue("handles was called with 'login'",
"null".equals(mAction._HandlesActionToken+"") );
}

********************************************************
